behaviorLimitations.description: Cannot write to storage root (0x00000000). SendObject fails with InvalidParameter when parent handle is 0.
behaviorLimitations.workaround: Use first available folder as parent container instead of storage root.

notes: Same tuning as ff10 variant with vendor-specific (0xff) MTP interface matching.
Requires 250-500 ms stabilization after OpenSession.
Prefer direct USB port; keep screen unlocked.

warnings.message: Samsung device did not respond on expected MTP interface. Trying alternate interfaces.

notes: Vendor-specific interface class (0xff) discovered by shared MTP heuristic.
Increased post-claim stabilize to 500ms for Samsung MTP stack readiness.
Probe ladder tries sessionless GetDeviceInfo, then OpenSession+GetDeviceInfo, then GetStorageIDs.
Added beforeGetStorageIDs hook with busy-backoff to wait for storage readiness.
Storage enumeration now retries up to 5 times with exponential backoff (400ms to 5s).
Read validation is reliable; write smoke remains best-effort.

behaviorLimitations.description: Cannot write to storage root (0x00000000). SendObject fails with InvalidParameter when parent handle is 0.
behaviorLimitations.workaround: Use first available folder as parent container instead of storage root.

notes: OnePlus 3T (ONEPLUS A3010) probes in ~115 ms; no resetOnOpen needed with new claim sequence.
PTP Device Reset (0x66) NOT supported (rc=-9, LIBUSB_ERROR_PIPE); skipPTPReset=true.
Session opens instantly (0 ms), no retry needed.
SendObject returns 0x201D (InvalidParameter) when writing to storage root; use a subfolder as parent.
Second USB interface is Mass Storage (class=0x08); ignored by MTP transport.
Fallback strategies: enum=propList5, read=partial64, write=partial.

warnings.message: Pixel 7 not exposing MTP interfaces. Check: 1) USB mode is MTP (adb shell getprop sys.usb.config), 2) Computer is trusted (check Pixel prompt), 3) USB debugging enabled in Developer Options.
Chrome/WebUSB may be holding this device. Quit all Chromium-based browsers (Chrome, Edge, Brave) and unplug/replug the device.

behaviorLimitations.description: Pixel 7 Still Image class (0x06) interface is not responding. This is a macOS/Pixel USB stack issue where the device is not exposing MTP interfaces properly. See Docs/SwiftMTP.docc/macOS26.md for troubleshooting.
behaviorLimitations.workaround: Ensure Pixel is in MTP mode with USB debugging enabled and computer is trusted. Try PTP mode as alternative.

notes: ROOT CAUSE: Device is not exposing MTP interfaces to macOS (no IOUSBInterface children in ioreg).
Symptom: Claim succeeds but bulk writes timeout (sent=0/12, rc=-7).
This is a Pixel 7 / macOS 26.2 USB stack incompatibility, NOT a SwiftMTP bug.
Required: Enable Developer Options, USB debugging, and trust the computer on the Pixel.
Alternative: Try PTP mode (adb usb ptp) instead of MTP.
Samsung and Xiaomi devices work correctly; Pixel 7 Still Image class is not being exposed.
Canon EOS cameras use PTP over USB with PTPIP-style initialization.
Large RAW files (>20 MB) may require extended ioTimeoutMs.
Camera must be in PTP/MTP mode (not PC Connection mode).
Event pump needed for capture events (0x4001 ObjectAdded).
Battery level can be read via GetDevicePropValue (0xD002).
Nikon D-series cameras use PTP over USB.
Camera must be in MTP/PTP mode via Settings > USB Options.
Liveview and capture events require Nikon vendor extensions (0x9xxx).
NEF raw files are large (15-30 MB); extend ioTimeoutMs if needed.
Some Nikon bodies support GetObjectSizeU64 via property 0xDC04.

governance.verificationNotes: Added from libgphoto2 camlibs/ptp2/library.c line 2864. First-generation GoPro HERO in PTP mode. Supports GetObjectPropList (0x9805) and basic PTP operations. Probe file not yet available; evidence required.
Added from libgphoto2 camlibs/ptp2/library.c line 2865. Sourced from libmtp issue tracker commit reference 39841e9a. PTP class device; GetObjectPropList supported.
Added from libgphoto2 camlibs/ptp2/library.c line 2868. Reference: sourceforge.net/p/gphoto/support-requests/130/. PTP class device; GetObjectPropList supported.

Added from libgphoto2 camlibs/ptp2/library.c line 2870. Confirmed by Tomas Zigo via libgphoto2 mailing list. Probe data in camlibs/ptp2/cameras/gopro-hero3.txt confirms PTP class (VendorExtID=0x6), GetObjectPropList (0x9805), GetPartialObject (0x101b).
Added from libgphoto2 camlibs/ptp2/library.c line 2872. Reference: libmtp commit 39841e9a15ed250a0121ae4a139b2a950a07f08c. PTP class device. Probe log required for confirmation.
Added from libgphoto2 camlibs/ptp2/library.c line 2874. Sourced from libmtp feature-requests/239. PTP class device; GetObjectPropList supported.
Added from libgphoto2 camlibs/ptp2/library.c line 2875. Sourced from libmtp (see HERO5 Black companion entry). PTP class device; GetObjectPropList supported.
Added from libgphoto2 camlibs/ptp2/library.c line 2878. Reference: sourceforge.net/p/libmtp/feature-requests/239/. PTP class device; GetObjectPropList supported.

Added from libgphoto2 camlibs/ptp2/library.c line 2880. Confirmed by Rasmus Larsson via libgphoto2. Probe data in camlibs/ptp2/cameras/gopro-hero7white.txt confirms VendorExtID=0x6 + android.com: 1.0, supports GetPartialObject64 (0x95c1) and SendPartialObject (0x95c2) - set conservatively to false pending testing.
Added from libgphoto2 camlibs/ptp2/library.c line 2882. Confirmed by Marcus Meissner (libgphoto2 maintainer). Same PTP profile as HERO7 White (0x0042).
Added from libgphoto2 camlibs/ptp2/library.c line 2884. Reference: sourceforge.net/p/libmtp/feature-requests/284/. Hero7 Black is the flagship; same PTP profile as HERO7 White (0x0042).
Added from libgphoto2 camlibs/ptp2/library.c line 2886. Reference: sourceforge.net/p/libmtp/bugs/1858/. PTP class device; GetObjectPropList supported.

PID 0x005c reported by community members via GoPro forums and GitHub issues as the HERO12 Black USB PID; not yet confirmed in libgphoto2 or libmtp as of 2025-07-14. Confidence low; probe log required before promoting.

Added from libmtp src/music-players.h line 4063 (DEVICE_FLAGS_ANDROID_BUGS). GPS running watch with onboard music storage. Android-style MTP (class 0xff). GetObjectPropList disabled due to DEVICE_FLAG_BROKEN_MTPGETOBJPROPLIST_ALL. Note: this is a GPS/fitness wearable, not a VIRB action camera.

Added from libmtp src/music-players.h line 4073 (DEVICE_FLAGS_ANDROID_BUGS). GPS multisport watch with music and Garmin Pay. Android-style MTP (class 0xff). GetObjectPropList disabled due to DEVICE_FLAG_BROKEN_MTPGETOBJPROPLIST_ALL. Note: this is a GPS/fitness wearable, not a VIRB action camera.

Added from libmtp src/music-players.h line 4085 (DEVICE_FLAGS_ANDROID_BUGS). Premium GPS multisport watch. Android-style MTP (class 0xff). GetObjectPropList disabled due to DEVICE_FLAG_BROKEN_MTPGETOBJPROPLIST_ALL. Note: this is a GPS/fitness wearable, not a VIRB action camera.

Added from libmtp src/music-players.h line 4079 (DEVICE_FLAGS_ANDROID_BUGS). GPS smartwatch with AMOLED display and Garmin Pay. Android-style MTP (class 0xff). GetObjectPropList disabled due to DEVICE_FLAG_BROKEN_MTPGETOBJPROPLIST_ALL. Note: this is a GPS/fitness wearable, not a VIRB action camera.

Added from libmtp src/music-players.h line 4115 (DEVICE_FLAGS_ANDROID_BUGS). Premium GPS smartwatch with AMOLED display. Android-style MTP (class 0xff). GetObjectPropList disabled due to DEVICE_FLAG_BROKEN_MTPGETOBJPROPLIST_ALL. Note: this is a GPS/fitness wearable, not a VIRB action camera.
